site_name: CHARLES Mc GINNIS & DEBBI Mc GINNIS

citations.narrative:
Five adult Corgis were seen in an enclosure by inspectors with no water. The inspection occurred at 11:18am and the
licensee stated that he had given the dogs water that morning before he went into town, but they had knocked it over and
he was just now coming back out to do chores. When the licensee was providing water, the dogs were seen gathering
near the hose to try and get at the water and then drank from the bowl continuously for at least 1 minute. Failure to
provide potable water could have a negative impact on the health and well-being of the dogs. The license must provide
potable water to the dogs and ensure they have access to potable water at all times.
To be corrected by: The licensee provided each dog with water at the time of inspection and must continue to provide
water continuously for all dogs from today 08 April 2025 on.
The inspection and initial exit interview were conducted with the licensee on 08 April 2025. The licensee acknowledged
understanding of the correction date at the time of the inspection. The exit interview was completed on 09 April 2025.
Additional Inspectors:
Alexandra Friedman, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.10(a)  Direct
   
Watering 
Five adult Corgis were seen in an enclosure by inspectors with no water. The inspection occurred at 11:18am and the 
licensee stated that he had given the dogs water that morning before he went into town, but they had knocked it over and 
he was just now coming back out to do chores. When the licensee was providing water, the dogs were seen gathering 
near the hose to try and get at the water and then drank from the bowl continuously for at least 1 minute. Failure to 
provide potable water could have a negative impact on the health and well-being of the dogs. The license must provide 
potable water to the dogs and ensure they have access to potable water at all times.  
To be corrected by: The licensee provided each dog with water at the time of inspection and must continue to provide 
water continuously for all dogs from today 08 April 2025 on. 
 
The inspection and initial exit interview were conducted with the licensee on 08 April 2025. The licensee acknowledged 
understanding of the correction date at the time of the inspection. The exit interview was completed on 09 April 2025. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Alexandra Friedman, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
